main event: A civilian observed a single, bright, elongated light in the sky, suspected to be an aircraft but not conforming to typical characteristics.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes., The object was observed at approximately 2242Z on August 3, 1956., The object was described as an elongated bright light., The witness reported it did not conform to standard aircraft characteristics., Various conclusions suggested the object could be a balloon, meteor, or an astronomical star or planet.
